event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The XSCFU_C and XSCFU_B have mismatched board numbers. This problem will only occur during platform power-on.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The XSCFU_C and XSCFU_B have mismatched board numbers.
    
This problem will only occur during platform power-on.

No domains will be allowed to be powered up until the problem is corrected.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Apr 14 16:00:57 san-dc3-1-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: BE80601000  
   EVENT-ID: 10554ff1-401e-4def-aca0-b52b36bf3f82
   Refer to %FMAURL%/ SCF-8006-X5 for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8006-X5, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Sat Apr 14 16:00:57 EDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: san-dc3-1-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 10554ff1-401e-4def-aca0-b52b36bf3f82
   DESC: The XSCFU_C and XSCFU_B have mismatched board numbers. This problem will only
   occur during platform power-on.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8006-X5 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: No domains will be allowed to be powered up until the problem is corrected.
   IMPACT: The entire platform is unbootable.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 10554ff1-401e-4def-aca0-b52b36bf3f82
        
         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Apr 14 16:00:57.3253 10554ff1-401e-4def-aca0-b52b36bf3f82 SCF-8006-X5
   
           66%  fault.chassis.device.mismatch

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/xscfu_c=0
                   Affects: hc:///chassis=0/xscfu_c=0
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=BE80601000:
                                  server-id=san-dc3-1-0:Serial:PP0639M503
                                  part=CA20396-B32X 011AL:revision=0301h/component=/XSCFU_C#0

           33%  fault.chassis.device.mismatch

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/xscfu=0
                   Affects: hc:///chassis=0/xscfu_c=0
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=BE80601000:
                                  server-id=san-dc3-1-0:Serial:PP0640T618
                                  part=CA06620-D341 0201h:revision=0201h/component=/XSCFU_B#0



Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
response
event_registry_properties.item: No domains will be allowed to be powered up until the problem is corrected.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: The XSCFU_C and XSCFU_B have mismatched board numbers.
